meanings.definition: At the point of death; in terminal decline.
meanings.sent1: The old, sick dog looked moribund, barely moving.
meanings.sent2: The hospital staff knew the patient was moribund and called the family.
meanings.sent3: The moribund computer finally crashed after years of slow performance.
meanings.sent4: The once bustling town now lay moribund, its streets empty and silent.
meanings.sent5: The moribund plant wilted in the dry soil, its leaves turning brown.

meanings.definition: In a state of inactivity or obsolescence.
meanings.sent1: The moribund factory had not produced anything in years.
meanings.sent2: The moribund law had not been enforced for decades.
meanings.sent3: The moribund clock on the wall was always stuck at the same time.
meanings.sent4: The moribund tradition faded away as new customs took its place.
meanings.sent5: The moribund library rarely had visitors, its books gathering dust.
